awd_titl_txt: Elastic and Transport Properties in Spin-ordered Solid      Helium Three
awd_abstract_narration: Professor Osheroff will determine properties of the                             nuclear antiferromagnetism in solid 3He to provide increased                    understanding of cooperative magnetic phenomena.  The                           sub-milliKelvin solid growth techniques which the PI pioneered                  will be used in measurements of the nuclear magnetic                            resonance (NMR), heat flow, and sound propagation phenomena.  The               strong temperature dependence of the antiferromagnetic resonance                will be used to measure the entire thermal distribution across a                heat carrying single crystal.  Thermal diffusivities will be                    determined as well as various magnon scattering probabilities.                  From sound studies the solid elastic constants of the ordered                   phases and the tensor components of the magnetic Gruneisen                      constant will be measured.  Lattice distortions will be obtained                from the NMR studies.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
